definitions.definition: Any of several green-hued minerals used for making various artefacts in early Mesoamerican cultures, e.g. greenschist , chlorastrolite , serpentine , omphacite , or chrysoprase .
The pounamu , the green-hued minerals of New Zealand used by the Māori to make tools , ornaments and weapons (any of three varieties of nephrite jade or one variety of bowenite ).

main_definition: ( archaeology ) Any of several green-hued minerals used for making various artefacts in early Mesoamerican cultures, e.g. greenschist , chlorastrolite , serpentine , omphacite , or chrysoprase .
secondary_definitions: ( New Zealand ) The pounamu , the green-hued minerals of New Zealand used by the Māori to make tools , ornaments and weapons (any of three varieties of nephrite jade or one variety of bowenite ).
